skill.name: paper-2-web
skill.description: This skill should be used when converting academic papers into promotional and presentation formats including interactive websites (Paper2Web), presentation videos (Paper2Video), and conference posters (Paper2Poster). Use this skill for tasks involving paper dissemination, conference preparation, creating explorable academic homepages, generating video abstracts, or producing print-ready posters from LaTeX or PDF sources.
skill.summary: This skill should be used when converting academic papers into promotional and presentation formats ...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: No code or scripts in the skill materials access sensitive files, environment variables, or networks. Documentation references expected APIs and tools only.

content.user_title: Transform papers into web, video, and posters
content.value_statement: Academic papers are hard to share across audiences. This skill turns LaTeX or PDF into a website, poster, and presentation video.
actual_capabilities: Generate interactive paper websites with sections, figures, and citations
Create print-ready posters with custom sizes and templates
Produce narrated presentation videos with slides and optional talking-head
Support LaTeX or PDF inputs and batch processing
Organize outputs into website, poster, and video folders
limitations: Complex equations may need manual review
Very long papers can require extended processing time
Talking-head video requires a high-end NVIDIA GPU
Logo discovery needs Google API keys

use_cases.title: Publish a paper homepage
use_cases.description: Create an interactive website that summarizes a new paper and links to figures, code, and references.

use_cases.title: Build a print-ready poster
use_cases.description: Generate a custom size poster with readable typography and high resolution figures.

use_cases.title: Create a video abstract
use_cases.description: Produce a narrated presentation video to share findings with broader audiences.

prompt_templates.title: Quick website
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert my LaTeX paper into an interactive website. Use standard sections and include figures and citations.

prompt_templates.title: Poster with size
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a conference poster from this paper. Set size to 60 by 40 inches and include institution branding.

prompt_templates.title: Video abstract
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a five minute video abstract with slides and narration from my paper PDF.

prompt_templates.title: Full package
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a website, poster, and video for this paper. Use GPT-4.1 and enable logo search.

output_examples.input: Make a website and poster from my LaTeX paper
output: Interactive website with abstract, methods, results, and references
Print-ready poster PDF with balanced layout and high resolution figures
Organized output folders for assets and files

best_practices: Provide clean LaTeX with all figures and bibliography
Review outputs for accuracy and readability on multiple devices
Use high resolution figures and vector formats when possible
anti_patterns: Uploading scanned PDFs with no selectable text
Skipping manual review of equations and complex figures
Generating a talking-head video without GPU support

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: It works with LaTeX or PDF inputs and generates standard web, PDF, and video outputs.

faq.question: Are there size or length limits?
faq.answer: Very long papers may take longer and need manual content prioritization.

faq.question: Can I integrate with hosting?
faq.answer: Yes, generated websites can be deployed to GitHub Pages or other hosting services.

faq.question: How is data handled?
faq.answer: The skill documentation does not describe data collection or exfiltration.

faq.question: What if generation fails?
faq.answer: Check dependencies, disk space, and API keys, then review logs in the output directory.

faq.question: How does it compare to basic converters?
faq.answer: It adds layout design, interactive elements, and poster or video outputs beyond simple HTML conversion.
